title: I recently returned for a visit to Winter Park School, which I attended for six years in the 1950-1960\'s. Several portraits of former principals of the school, including Mr. Jack McGee, were laying in an administrator\'s office, visible to nobody. Have they been hung? If not, why? So many of us who attended Winter Park while Mr. McGee was principal will say he had a huge impact on our lives. He is a vital part of the school\'s history and its legacy.
text: Here's a link to the answer to your question. http://www.myreporter.com/?p=19128
